Author: isaezraa
Text: check the labels, diet sport drinks usually only have one of the 4+ electrolytes full calorie drinks have, so it’s really not giving you any benefits. check to see if your local chemist has any electrolyte products, they’ll be more likely to be low in sugar and high in what you actually need

Author: SubBiscuit
Text: Propel makes a 0 cal electrolyte powder and there are other electrolyte tablets etc that you add to water that are low cal. I specifically use a brand called Nuun and can recommend it but there are plenty of others.  With Powerade/Gatorade and things you have to watch out for the added sugar, they're normally loaded. I'm not overly familiar with coconut milk because I dont like the taste, but again it will likely be better if it doesnt have much outside of water and electrolytes.  Anything for harm reduction I *think* is allowed here, because I'm always preaching about electrolytes. Side benefit they help me with bloating.
